## Overview

<p>Provide helpers with asynchronous tasks like <a href="/@std/async@1.0.15/doc/~/delay" rel="nofollow"><code>delays</code></a>,
<a href="/@std/async@1.0.15/doc/~/debounce" rel="nofollow"><code>debouncing</code></a>, <a href="/@std/async@1.0.15/doc/~/retry" rel="nofollow"><code>retrying</code></a>, or
<a href="/@std/async@1.0.15/doc/~/pooledMap" rel="nofollow"><code>pooling</code></a>.</p>
<pre class="highlight"><code><span class="pl-k">import</span> { delay } <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s">"@std/async/delay"</span>;

<span class="pl-k">await</span> <span class="pl-en">delay</span>(<span class="pl-c1">100</span>); <span class="pl-c">// waits for 100 milliseconds</span>
</code></pre>

<!-- custom:start -->
## Advanced Delay Patterns

You can combine `delay` with `AbortSignal` to support cancellation:

```ts
import { delay } from "@std/async/delay";

const ac = new AbortController();
const p = delay(5000, { signal: ac.signal });
setTimeout(() => ac.abort(), 100); // cancel quickly
try {
  await p;
} catch (err) {
  if (err instanceof DOMException && err.name === "AbortError") {
    console.log("Cancelled");
  }
}
```
<!-- custom:end -->
